review: I'd like to start by saying Wow, thank you google. We loved the Chromecast so much that we purchased a second one and even a few more for gifts. It just makes our viewing experience alot more simplistic. Practically anything we would like to see on the television can be streamed from a phone, laptop, tablet, etc. I personally believe that these types of devices are the future and Google is paving the way for a much anticipated POST big cable company world. Would definitely recommend to anyone.

review: I like it so far, after a week's use. Very easy to set up. I was worried about using my smartphone and/or tablet as the only remote, but have overcome that fear. Once it finds your plugged-in Chromecast, downloaded the Chromecast app and Chromecast remote, works better, for my uses, than my 7 year old Roku box. Faster action f than the Roku remote, nicer interface. I currently use it only at home, but will broadcast on my phone or my tablet. I currently only subscribe to Netflix monthly, which is fine with me in conjunction with a nice big cable bill that I don't have to pay for; I just happen to live here. For the budget-conscious, I paid just under $23 for it, plugged the included AC adapter into the wall, and it gives a very nice HD signal on my 720p HD (capable of 1080i) eight year old teevee.
